The construction vehicle's presence directly in the path of the ego vehicle affects its immediate driving behavior. The ego car must maintain a safe following distance and be prepared to stop or slow down if the construction vehicle does so.

Monitoring their speed and trajectory is necessary to maintain traffic flow and ensure safety.

vulnerable_road_users.description: A pedestrian standing on the right side of the road, facing away from the ego car, in close proximity to the construction vehicle

The proximity of the pedestrian to the road increases the risk of an accidental incursion into the lane of the ego vehicle, requiring vigilance and readiness to react.

barriers.explanation: This barrier limits the road's width and the ability for the ego car to move to the right, especially important if the fork-lift truck or other vehicles make unpredictable movements.
